segment.source: description: Before using ad mediation, you'll need to set up accounts with each ad network that you’d like to use in your apps.
segment.target: description: Before using ad mediation, you'll need to set up accounts with each ad network that you’d like to use in your apps.

segment.source: title: Select and manage your ad networks
segment.target: title: Select and manage your ad networks

segment.source: Select and manage your ad networks
segment.target: Select and manage your ad networks

segment.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]

segment.source: Before using ad mediation, you'll need to set up accounts with each ad network that you’d like to use in your apps.
segment.target: Before using ad mediation, you'll need to set up accounts with each ad network that you’d like to use in your apps.

segment.source: We recommend doing this before you add the ad mediator control to your Microsoft Visual Studio project.
segment.target: We recommend doing this before you add the ad mediator control to your Microsoft Visual Studio project.

segment.source: We also recommend that you set up accounts with as many ad networks as possible, so you have maximum flexibility to optimize your ad mediation performance.
segment.target: We also recommend that you set up accounts with as many ad networks as possible, so you have maximum flexibility to optimize your ad mediation performance.

segment.source: Supported ad networks and project types
segment.target: Supported ad networks and project types

segment.source: Currently, ad mediation is supported for the following ad networks and project types.
segment.target: Currently, ad mediation is supported for the following ad networks and project types.

segment.source: Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app using C# or Visual Basic with XAML
segment.target: Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app using C# or Visual Basic with XAML

segment.source: Windows 8.1 app using C# or Visual Basic with XAML
segment.target: Windows 8.1 app using C# or Visual Basic with XAML

segment.source: Windows Phone 8.1 app using C# or Visual Basic with XAML
segment.target: Windows Phone 8.1 app using C# or Visual Basic with XAML

segment.source: Some project types, such as C++ with XAML and JavaScript with HTML, are not currently supported by ad mediation.
segment.target: Some project types, such as C++ with XAML and JavaScript with HTML, are not currently supported by ad mediation.

segment.source: For these project types, you can show ads from Microsoft Advertising without using ad mediation.
segment.target: For these project types, you can show ads from Microsoft Advertising without using ad mediation.

segment.source: For more information, see AdControl in XAML and .NET and AdControl in HTML 5 and JavaScript.
segment.target: For more information, see AdControl in XAML and .NET and AdControl in HTML 5 and JavaScript.

segment.source: Specific parameters and details for each network
segment.target: Specific parameters and details for each network

segment.source: Here are the specific details you'll need for each ad network, including how to set up your account and how to onboard an app.
segment.target: Here are the specific details you'll need for each ad network, including how to set up your account and how to onboard an app.

segment.source: We also list the required parameters that you need to provide when you submit your app and configure ad mediation (and/or in Connected Services for testing your ad mediation implementation).
segment.target: We also list the required parameters that you need to provide when you submit your app and configure ad mediation (and/or in Connected Services for testing your ad mediation implementation).

segment.source: For more details about using a specific ad network, visit its website.
segment.target: For more details about using a specific ad network, visit its website.

segment.source: In addition to the required parameters, each ad network also has additional optional parameters you can set via code in your app.
segment.target: In addition to the required parameters, each ad network also has additional optional parameters you can set via code in your app.

segment.source: For examples, see Optional ad network parameters later in this topic.
segment.target: For examples, see Optional ad network parameters later in this topic.

segment.source: For the complete list of optional parameters, see the documentation provided by each ad network.
segment.target: For the complete list of optional parameters, see the documentation provided by each ad network.

segment.source: Some of these parameters will be ignored or overwritten by ad mediation, and these are listed in the sections below.
segment.target: Some of these parameters will be ignored or overwritten by ad mediation, and these are listed in the sections below.

segment.source: For example, parameters related to current location are usually overwritten with information about the customer's location that is determined by the location capability within the app itself.
segment.target: For example, parameters related to current location are usually overwritten with information about the customer's location that is determined by the location capability within the app itself.

segment.source: Note that when you add the ad mediator control and specify which ad networks to use, Visual Studio attempts to fetch the required assemblies programmatically for some ad networks.
segment.target: Note that when you add the ad mediator control and specify which ad networks to use, Visual Studio attempts to fetch the required assemblies programmatically for some ad networks.

segment.source: If there are any assemblies that cannot be automatically retrieved, you can install them using the links shown below for each ad network.
segment.target: If there are any assemblies that cannot be automatically retrieved, you can install them using the links shown below for each ad network.

segment.source: To configure ad network parameters, use the Monetize with ads page on the Windows Dev Center dashboard.
segment.target: To configure ad network parameters, use the Monetize with ads page on the Windows Dev Center dashboard.

segment.source: Add the ad mediation control to your app, and submit your app to the Windows Dev Center dashboard.
segment.target: Add the ad mediation control to your app, and submit your app to the Windows Dev Center dashboard.

segment.source: ApplicationId and AdUnitId: These parameters are automatically filled in for you when you submit your app package, based on the contents of your app.
segment.target: ApplicationId and AdUnitId: These parameters are automatically filled in for you when you submit your app package, based on the contents of your app.

segment.source: However, you can optionally edit these parameters when you submit your app and configure ad mediation.
segment.target: However, you can optionally edit these parameters when you submit your app and configure ad mediation.

segment.source: Height and Width (only required for Windows Phone 8 Silverlight and Windows Phone 8.1 Silverlight).
segment.target: Height and Width (only required for Windows Phone 8 Silverlight and Windows Phone 8.1 Silverlight).

segment.source: First, try to let the ad mediator control retrieve the assemblies through Connected Services as described in Add and use the ad mediator control.
segment.target: First, try to let the ad mediator control retrieve the assemblies through Connected Services as described in Add and use the ad mediator control.

segment.source: If you need to download them manually, go to the Getting Started section on the AdDuplex website.
segment.target: If you need to download them manually, go to the Getting Started section on the AdDuplex website.

segment.source: In the AdDuplex portal, create a new app.
segment.target: In the AdDuplex portal, create a new app.

segment.source: First, try to let the ad mediator control retrieve the assemblies through Connected Services as described in Add and use the ad mediator control.
segment.target: First, try to let the ad mediator control retrieve the assemblies through Connected Services as described in Add and use the ad mediator control.

segment.source: If you need to download them manually, go to the Downloads tab in the Smaato portal.
segment.target: If you need to download them manually, go to the Downloads tab in the Smaato portal.

segment.source: In the Smaato portal, go to My Spaces and generate a new Adspace.
segment.target: In the Smaato portal, go to My Spaces and generate a new Adspace.

segment.source: Height and Width (only required for Windows 8.1 XAML)
segment.target: Height and Width (only required for Windows 8.1 XAML)

segment.source: Get the Windows Phone 8 SDK from the Google Mobile Ads SDK website.
segment.target: Get the Windows Phone 8 SDK from the Google Mobile Ads SDK website.

segment.source: In the AdMob portal, select Monetize new app.
segment.target: In the AdMob portal, select Monetize new app.

segment.source: First, try to let the ad mediator control retrieve the assemblies through Connected Services as described in Add and use the ad mediator control.
segment.target: First, try to let the ad mediator control retrieve the assemblies through Connected Services as described in Add and use the ad mediator control.

segment.source: If you need to download them manually, sign in to your account and go to the SDK tab in the Dashboard to download the Windows Phone 8 SDK.
segment.target: If you need to download them manually, sign in to your account and go to the SDK tab in the Dashboard to download the Windows Phone 8 SDK.

segment.source: In the Inneractive portal, create a new app.
segment.target: In the Inneractive portal, create a new app.

segment.source: First, try to let the ad mediator control retrieve the assemblies through Connected Services as described in Add and use the ad mediator control.
segment.target: First, try to let the ad mediator control retrieve the assemblies through Connected Services as described in Add and use the ad mediator control.

segment.source: If you need to download them manually, go to the SDK section on the VMAX website.
segment.target: If you need to download them manually, go to the SDK section on the VMAX website.

segment.source: Obtain the Adspot ID for your app from the VMAX website (the Adspot ID is called ZoneId in the VMAX APIs).
segment.target: Obtain the Adspot ID for your app from the VMAX website (the Adspot ID is called ZoneId in the VMAX APIs).

segment.source: In addition to the required parameters, each ad network also has additional optional parameters you can set via code in your app.
segment.target: In addition to the required parameters, each ad network also has additional optional parameters you can set via code in your app.

segment.source: For the complete list of optional parameters, see the documentation provided by each ad network.
segment.target: For the complete list of optional parameters, see the documentation provided by each ad network.

segment.source: To set these optional parameters in your code, use the AdSdkOptionalParameters property of your AdMediatorControl object.
segment.target: To set these optional parameters in your code, use the AdSdkOptionalParameters property of your AdMediatorControl object.

segment.source: The following example demonstrates how to set the CountryOrRegion parameter for Microsoft Advertising.
segment.target: The following example demonstrates how to set the CountryOrRegion parameter for Microsoft Advertising.

segment.source: The following example demonstrates how to set the Width and Height parameters for Smaato.
segment.target: The following example demonstrates how to set the Width and Height parameters for Smaato.

segment.source: Add and use the ad mediation control
segment.target: Add and use the ad mediation control

segment.source: Submit your app and configure ad mediation
segment.target: Submit your app and configure ad mediation
